thread.title: Swans Announce The Great Annihilator Reissue
thread.title_full: Swans Announce The Great Annihilator Reissue

author: Sheldon Pearce
title: Swans Announce The Great Annihilator Reissue
text:
Swans Announce The Great Annihilator Reissue With Michael Gira’s solo debut Drainland as a companion Swans Photo by Hiroyuki Ito/Getty Images 
Swans have announced a reissue of their 1995 album The Great Annihilator . It’s out on April 28 via Young God Records/Mute. It will be released on double vinyl and as a 2xCD set with a companion CD featuring Michael Gira’s solo debut, Drainland . The Great Annihilator was remastered by Doug Henderson after Bill Rieflin recently discovered DATs and cassettes containing unmastered mixes from the original sessions. In a press release, Gira describes the discovery as “a revelation of great sonic effect.” 
The Great Annihilator is just the latest Swans album to get a reissue. In 2014, the band reissued their debut album, Filth , on vinyl. The next year, they bolstered the release with additional bonus material . That year, they also reissued two more albums: 1991’s White Light From the Mouth of Infinity and 1992’s Love of Life.
